result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M. Klemmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dawn M. Klemmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dawn M. Klemmer in court with attorney Andrew Martin Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan  files amended information.  Plead to amended information   7 days jail  4 days credit.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to charge in the amended information.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of charge in the amended information . Court orders 7 days Pierce County Jail  credit for 4 days.   Jail Sentence stayed until 9-21-15 at 7:00 PM  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Oral Ruling held on June 24, 2015 with Judge Boles presiding. Filed by RMR Carlson
Pre-trial conference at 08-17-2015 02:15 pm.

2:34 Defendant Dawn M. Klemmer in court with attorney Andrew Martin Nelson, who appeared via phone.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court:  cites Supreme Court case 2008 State vs Dank. Court notes No evidence either Officer was concerned with their safety. Court denies Atty Nelson's motion. No charge for paraphenilla in the form of a syringe but can't contain illegal evidence. Court: Search of the syringe is reasonable and that motion is denied.
Defendant's Argument in Support of Motion for Suppression of Evidence filed by Atty Nelson
of Attorney Rory O'Sullvan
Oral ruling at 06-24-2015 02:30 pm.

3:42 p.m.  Defendant Dawn M. Klemmer in court with attorney Andrew Martin Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to suppress.  O'Sullivan asks bond be amended to $50 cash bond.  Nelson opposes request.  Court denies request to amend bond to cash bond.  O'Sullivan calls Officer Mitchell Rhiel.  Rhiel is sworn and takes the stand.  O'Sullivan examines Rhiel.  Rhiel identifies defendant.  Nelson cross-examines Rhiel. O'Sullivan does re-direct.  Nelson does re-cross.  O'Sullivan calls Officer Robbie Jaeger.  Jaeger is sworn and takes the stand.  O'Sullivan examines Jaeger.  Nelson cross-examines Jaeger.  Nelson gives closing argument.  Court address Mr. Nelson.  Nelson to submit briefs within 10 days and court will decide the matter at that time.
granted
Motion hearing at 06-01-2015 03:00 pm.
For Suppression of Evidence filed by Andrew Nelson
Motion hearing at 04-06-2015 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dawn M. Klemmer

Prior: 7491 - 98th St., Cottage Grove, MN 55016

CO: Gavic, DA Froelich appr. for State, Atty. Andrew Nelson w/Defendant Dawn Klemmer.  Case called at 4:56 p.m.  Atty. Nelson notes Defendant missed prior appearance and warrant was authorized.  State withdraws request for warrant.  Court quashes.  Court advises Defendant that she needs to go to Jail for prints.
Motion hearing on March 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
filed by Andrew Nelson
Andrew Nelson
filed by Sean Froelich
Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 28, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Def pleas not guilty to charge. Court enters in not guilty plea. Goes over bond conditions with Def. Def remain until she is handed a notice of the next hearing.

9:11 Defendant Dawn M. Klemmer in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Eric Michels swn, ex by Atty Froelich. Witness ID's Def. Court: record will reflect indentification. Hargrove x ex. Court: finds the Def probably committed the felony and binds the Def over for trial. Atty Froelich files information.  Court reads charges and maximum penalties; Def waives further reading.
filed by Josh Hargrove
JH
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.

2:36  Defendant Dawn M. Klemmer in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant still does not have attorney but requests to have an attorney. This preliminary hearing will be reschedled.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

2:43 p.m.  Defendant Dawn M. Klemmer in court.  Sean E Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich asks preliminary hearing be continued as Ms. Klemmer has retained an attorney but the attorney is not here at this time.  Ms. Klemmer waives the right to have the hearing within 20 days.   Bond to continue with all conditions.  See Clerk of Court for new date.
Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  not a vet.
